pages.title: About
pages.description: Ralph is a Chief Technology Officer as well as an Advisor at various (blockchain) startups. He solves complex challenges and provides solutions in Product Development, Software Architecture, Infrastructure, Automation and Security.

pages.title: Artificial Intelligence
pages.description: Since 2023 I have been playing with Stable Diffusion for text-to-image generative AI, and Kohya_SS for training my own LoRa models.

pages.title: Enterprise Architecture Projects
pages.description: For 20+ years I have worked on projects in corporate environments as a Senior Solution Architect in IT Service Management.

pages.title: Blockchain Projects
pages.description: I‚Äôve been very enthusiastic about the possibilities of Blockchain since 2010 (especially after reading the Bitcoin whitepaper). I have tried to work on concepts where transparency of historic events, through blockchain, makes sense.  Now, in 2024, I‚Äôm a lot more skeptical about there being many usecases apart from Bitcoin.

pages.title: Home
pages.content:
Welcome and thanks for visiting! I‚Äôm Ralph, a Chief Technology Officer from the Netherlands. I advise companies and manage startups with a strong, senior mentality bringing 25+ years of experience in bleeding-edge technology. 
I have worked in 40+ projects in corporate environments as a Senior Solution Architect in IT Service Management. For the last 14+ years I have specialised in Startups as well, many of which in the Blockchain scene, and I have been involved with Bitcoin since 2010. 
In 2017 I was a founding (and core team-) member of Pillar, one of the first cryptocurrency ICOs, where we raised $27M in 60 hours. In 2018 I was a core team member of Jinbi, an ICO where we raised $47M over 6 months.
Currently I‚Äôm primarily CTO of Apostille USA, a 100% automated platform for Apostille of Legal Documents; which reduces processing time from months to days. Created in March 2023, we‚Äôve had clients since the first month, and have been profitable since month four, all without external funding.

Networking and Pentesting became a natural extension of my learning. Wireless Networks and Sub-Ghz signals also fascinate me.

documents.title: iBitcoin
documents.content:
I started mining Bitcoin in 2010, and wanted to see my mining statistics on my phone whilst away.
My brother and I developed an app with Mining Stats, Market Data, Network Data and for a brief time wallet functionality 
via Exchange API calls, until Apple started noticing. We were in the Top 10 Finance apps for weeks and the first Bitcoin app to have wallet functionality, until Apple pulled our app from the AppStore for that.
Much of the functionality came from a personal need for information, as I had originally developed the concept for myself.

Up-to-date Prices

documents.title: Leesplankje
documents.content:
The concept was based on an old Dutch method for learning how to read, using a wooden board and blocks with letters. I developed a digital version of this method, using your fingers to drag letters. And when a letter is touched, it allows you to hear the proper pronounciation (in my Mom‚Äôs voice, as she collaborated with me üòÅ). This project was part of AppCodex.




Leesplankje for iPad (2010)



Leesplankje for iPad Mockup (2010)

Tutorial



Learn how to read with Leesplankje. Choose your difficulty (Easy, Medium, Hard) - Leesplankje for iPad (2010)



Rotate the iPad to see what the words should look like, turn sound on to hear the words - Leesplankje for iPad (2010)



Drag the letters to the empty placeholders. Tap the image to hear the word again. Leesplankje for iPad (2010)

Day 1 of Sales - Leesplankje for iPhone & iPad (2010)



Leesplankje was #2 in the Top Educational Apps for iPhone (AppStore), and was acquired by Noordhoff (largest Dutch educational publisher).

documents.title: Resistance Netherlands
documents.content:
In Niantic Labs AR GPS game ‚ÄòIngress‚Äô, there are two teams and the aim is to work together as a team to control local (geo-coordinated) locations at all time. 
I developed recruiting-methods, training-material, merchandise, organized events and helped build the national and local communitities grow for both teams. These designs and guidelines are still widely used by the community.

documents.title: Backlink Assassin
documents.content:
This project was an experiment to see how much one can detect and prove that certain domains are cheating Google PageRank by running Private Blog Networks (PBNs). It turned out quite successful, and over the course of about 6 months Google took down 100,000‚Äôs of backlinks to domains after they were exposed to be coming from PBNs with a 100% accuracy. 
The premise was simple: ‚ÄúIf a domain is useless, all of its outbound links to other domains are useless‚Äù. If you identify a domain with large numbers of backlinks to be a domain that no human would ever visit or find remotely interesting to spend time on, you likely found a PBN site. 
I traced inbound backlinks to powerful websites, and checked from what other domains their links were coming. Many of them were using dozens of domains with high Domain Authority that offered no useful information to a human, but insane amounts of backlinks for Google‚Äôs crawlers. 
This gave me an incredible insight into what powers the ‚Äúlink juice‚Äù for domains, and allowed me to see who is cheating (using backlinks from PBNs) and who isn‚Äôt (having organic backlinks). 
It also allowed me to report to Google, with high precision, what domains could be easily verified to be part of a PBN, and what backlinks should therefor be considered to solely exist for the purpose of ‚Äúmanipulating pagerank‚Äù. Once a domain is known to be part of a PBN, all of its outbound links are part as well.

Backlink Analysis Reports



An Domain Report containing a Backlink Analysis (sent to Google) on Pastebin - Header (2017)



Domain report - Target Summary (2017)



Domain report - Identified Paid Link resellers and IP-Addresses used by Target (2017)

documents.title: Wardial
documents.content:
Named after ‚ÄòWar dialing‚Äô from the 80s, this was a little Proof of Concept script to ‚Äòhack‚Äô Ethereum wallets by generating random wallet seeds and checking whether they have a balance. Basically ‚Äúdiscovering existing wallets‚Äù.
If a wallet with balance higher than 0 ETH was found, an alert would be sent through a Telegram bot.




The WarDial script being executed (2018)



The WarDial script being executed (2018)



214,000+ wallets had been checked (2018)

documents.title: Mpowa
documents.content:
Mpowa was set to revolutionise and democratise the production and consumption of energy. The project consisted of ‚ÄòMpowa Energy Units (battery hardware), in addition to a system to tokenize energy, so customers would only pay what they would use , and would be rewarded for sharing performance data. I was the CTO of the company, and left it in early 2020.

documents.title: Phibo
documents.content:
A client had found a way to predict / calculate any Prime Number, meaning many security systems are to be considered ‚Äúweak‚Äù or ‚Äúbroken‚Äù, because they are all based on Prime Numbers. I was asked to brainstorm about possibilities for technological products using new technology based on non-prime-numbers.

documents.title: Karakoram
documents.content:
Glacial Lake Ouburst Floods (GLOFs) occur when high mountain glaciers move and the friction created causes the ice to melt. An accumulation of water is created, which puts pressure on the sides of the glaciers. When they break, the water is released causing flash floods, often heavily impacting the communities downstream. The project received two grants from the National Geographic: in 2016 and 2018 two scientific expeditions took place in the Karakoram Mountains of Northern Pakistan to gather data and increase community awareness. I was part of the project‚Äôs third phase (which was postponed due to the pandemic): I developed a prototype Early Warning System for GLOFs, based on Mesh Networking and low-cost hardware.





A concept mockup of the technical prototype (Ralph Reijs - 2020)



Outdoor Journal - Oliver Foster (2020)



Photo Credit: Tim Taylor (2018)

documents.title: Applied Universal Mathematics
documents.content:
Based on Advanced Numbers Theory, together with a team, I designed and developed a Backtester to mathematically 
find Harmonic Points in any and all data, ranging from financial to natural, such as the occurrence to sunspots. The backtester could take any (large enough) datasource with timestamps and would demonstrate the ability to identify ‚Äòharmonic points‚Äô. An example of this is the ability to optimally detect Buy and Sell moments for stocks and cryptocurrency pairs.

Please note that the information below is heavily redacted due to NDA.





It all started with my favorite book, written by Anthony Morris.



An illustration of how beautifully perfect mathematics is. I made this chart to demonstrate the relation between mathematics and geometry when viewed through the Mod 9 perspective  (Ralph Reijs - 2021)



Alpha7 software. Harmonic Points in Historic Financial Data



Alpha7 software. Harmonic Points in Historical Public Data



Alpha7 software. Harmonic Points in Historical Financial Data



Alpha7 software. Backtester - Chart Mode



Alpha7 software. Backtester - Animated



Alpha7 software. Backtester - Closed Trades

documents.title: The FARMacy
documents.content:
The Concept

  Local, affordable, healthy food for everyone


What if.. healthy and affordable farm products could always be available in central urban stores? And products could be seamlessly traced to the farms through blockchain technology? And the loyalty of both consumers and producers would be rewarded transparently and all users could have access to simple dashboards on our proprietary platform?  We think this is possible, and we created a concept and prototype. 

Pitch Deck available on request



Admin Dashboard
The Admin has the complete overview. Products are picked up in batches, delivered at stores, and all important timestamps are recorded on the blockchain. 


The FARMacy Prototype - Farmer‚Äôs Dashboard (2022)

Farmer's Dashboard
The farmer doesn‚Äôt have to do anything other than what he usually does. He has a fixed supply of products that will be picked according to an agreed upon schedule. If he wants, he can log in to the Farmer‚Äôs Dashboard to see historic activities and insights.


The FARMacy Prototype - Farmer‚Äôs Dashboard (2022)

Van Driver's Dashboard
The Van Drivers has a schedule of picking up products at farms, and dropping off products at store(s), according to an agreed upon schedule.


The FARMacy Prototype - Van Driver‚Äôs Dashboard (2022)

Van Driver's Tasks: Dropoff


The FARMacy Prototype - Van Driver‚Äôs Tasks: Dropoff (2022)

Van Driver's Tasks: Pickup


The FARMacy Prototype - Van Driver‚Äôs Tasks: Pickup (2022)

Van Driver arrived at Pickup Location


The FARMacy Prototype - Van Driver arrived at Pickup Location (2022)

Store Owner's Dashboard
The Store Owner can check the batches coming in, going out, review by customers, engagement with the community, etc. 


The FARMacy Prototype - Store Owner Dashboard (2022)

User's Dashboard
The user can see the history of their products (produced when / where, picked up when / where, etc) for all their products and grow a relationship with their local farmer. 


The FARMacy Prototype - User Dashboard (2022)

documents.title: Toxic Maxi
documents.content:
Toxic Maxi helps individuals achieve self-custody over their Bitcoin, teaches them about the use of Bitcoin and helps companies integrate Bitcoin and Bitcoin Lightning.
Bitcoin is the single, most (fully) self-custodial asset in the world. Therefore it is important to know about it and understand how to use it. 
Bitcoin Lightning isn‚Äôt another coin, it is a complementary protocol based on the Bitcoin blockchain that works by using cryptographic side-chains to make transactions instant and near-free.

The company has not launched yet, check back soon for updates





Launch Announcement - Home Page



Home Page



What is a Toxic Maxi?

SeedSigner

Blockmit Product Page

documents.title: Apostille USA
documents.content:
The Apostille sector is not well known to the general public: as such it offers unique business opportunities. An apostille is a crucial document that serves as proof of the authenticity of another document that has been signed by a notary public. This certification is required by international law, and is issued by a government in accordance with the Hague Convention of 1961. The purpose of an apostille is to ensure that a document can be legally recognized and accepted in foreign countries.
This process can be time-consuming and complicated, this is why we developed a completely automated & integrated Document Apostille service, drastically removing bureacracy and reducing processing times. Revolutionary in the industry.
All of the following aspects have been automated:

  Order process
  Payment process
  Shipping Label creation
  Fulfillment (physical apostille in all 50 U.S. states via local partners)
  Delivery
  Automatic fixing of 98% of exceptions



Apostille USA is currently operating in the U.S. but we are exploring options to expand to other countries.







 Apostille USA: Place an Order in Less than a Minute! (2024)





 The Ultimate Guide to Apostille FBI Background Checks: Everything You Need to Know ! (2024)

documents.title: Instatunnel
documents.content:
Instatunnel was a concept around PrePaid VPN Bandwidth with zero logging. Each card gave a specific amount of guaranteed snoop-proof bandwidth. The prepaid cards were to be sold at retail points suchs as Airports, Hotels, Supermarkets. After cleaning the scratch-code on the back, the code could be redeemed on an activation portal, after which the VPN would connect.




Prepaid Cards (2013)



Beta Portal (2013)



Status Page (2013)

documents.title: Pillar
documents.content:
Founding Team Member, started as a tech generalist. After some months, we did a successful ICO and raised $27M in 60h. 
I fell in love with the original idea of the Personal Data Locker and decided I wanted to help build it.
During the ICO / Token Sale I handled the livestream broadcast and technical overlays / integrations. After the first Unconference I went to London to build our headquarters, and took position as Head of IT Security and Infrastructure.

documents.title: Wardial
documents.content:
Named after ‚ÄòWar dialing‚Äô from the 80s, this was a little Proof of Concept script to ‚Äòhack‚Äô Ethereum wallets by generating random wallet seeds and checking whether they have a balance. Basically ‚Äúdiscovering existing wallets‚Äù.
If a wallet with balance higher than 0 ETH was found, an alert would be sent through a Telegram bot.




The WarDial script being executed (2018)



The WarDial script being executed (2018)



214,000+ wallets had been checked (2018)



Example of generated wallets (2018)



Telegram bot for alerts (2018)

documents.title: IT Service Management
documents.content:
For more than 20 years, I have worked at large international organisations as a Senior Solution Architect for IT Service Management software. My clients are usually based in Europe, North America and the Middle East. They include Banks, Insurance companies, Pharmaceutical companies, Petrochemical companies, and are usually organisations with a 100.000 employees or more.

My Responsibilities include:

  Stakeholder Meetings
  Consolidation and discovery of functional and technical requirements
  Advisory to the Board / Process Owners
  Design of technical solution
  User Interface design
  Implementation of solutions according to company policy and SDLC
  Infrastructure analysis and stress-tests
  Security analysis & penetration tests
  Administrator and End-User Documentation
  Business Reporting
  Automation & Integration
  Support and Training of employees / end-users


ITIL Processes:

  Service Management
  Incident Management
  Problem Management
  Change Management
  Release Management
  Request Management
  Asset Management
  Knowledge Management
  Configuration Management
  Service Level Management


Clients


    
    
    
    
    
    
    
    
    
    
    
    
    
    
    
    
    
    
    
    
    
  




Peregrine ServiceCenter
I started in 1998 with Peregrine Systems ServiceCenter 3. The software was originally called PNMS (Problem Network Management System) for MVS / 3270 systems, and the GUI was based on ‚Äúlines‚Äù as to maintain backward compatibility with text-based UIs.



Peregrine Systems ServiceCenter v6 (2002)



HP ServiceManager
In 2005, HP acquired Peregrine Systems and made their various software products a part of the HP OpenView portfolio. ServiceCenter was then called ServiceManager, and it received a number of big updates that gave it less of a text-based GUI feeling.



HP ServiceManager v7 (2007)



ServiceNow
From around 2011, the ServiceNow platform (created by the former CTO of Peregrine Systems) had taken of a large share of the corporate IT Service Management market, and many corporations were making the switch.



ServiceNow (2015)

documents.title: Drones
documents.content:
I've been building Racing Drones since 2013, all with opensource software and hardware. Only since 2017 have I started using commercial consumer drones. So many beautiful places I have visited and flown FPV at ü•∞ 
  

I always dreamt of flying, and when building an FPV Drone became a realistic option, I jumped in and studied all I could, for 3 months. After that, I started building one drone after the other. Many of them FPV Racing Drones. These days I race less, but love Aerial Photography / Video. I‚Äôm still flying FPV in 2024.

documents.title: 3D Printing
documents.content:
In 2022 I started a project called Toxic Maxi, with the intention to educate people about Bitcoin and Bitcoin Lightning. In that context I started 3D Printing for the purpose of creating small cases for hardware-wallets, etc. A wonderful adventure that has taught me a great deal of things about manufacturing and design in 3D.



First 3D prints (2023)



Printing 24 whistles of 110dB (2023)



A pile of printed 110dB whistles (2023)



A steep learning curve. A lot of issues along the way. (2023)



And many lessons about fine details that could be printed better (2023)



And many ideas about things that could be better with the help of a little custom designed print. Such as this drying rack raiser (2023)



The Blockmit, an wonderful tool for making cheap but durable cold wallet, or backups of your seed phrase (2023)



The SeedSigner  (Orange Pill case), a low-cost, offline / Air-Gapped, transaction signer for Bitcoin (2023)



The SeedSigner (Open Pill case), a low-cost, offline / Air-Gapped, transaction signer for Bitcoin (2023)



Some duo-color Bitcoin keychains (2023)



A 3D Printed Eiffeltower (2023)



A lot of SeedSigners. A low-cost, offline / Air-Gapped, transaction signer for Bitcoin (2023)

documents.title: iBitcoin
documents.content:
I started mining Bitcoin in 2010, and wanted to see my mining statistics on my phone whilst away.
My brother and I developed an app with Mining Stats, Market Data, Network Data and for a brief time wallet functionality 
via Exchange API calls, until Apple started noticing. We were in the Top 10 Finance apps for weeks and the first Bitcoin app to have wallet functionality, until Apple pulled our app from the AppStore for that.
Much of the functionality came from a personal need for information, as I had originally developed the concept for myself.

documents.title: Pillar
documents.content:
Founding Team Member, started as a tech generalist. After some months, we did a successful ICO and raised $27M in 60h. 
I fell in love with the original idea of the Personal Data Locker and decided I wanted to help build it.
During the ICO / Token Sale I handled the livestream broadcast and technical overlays / integrations. After the first Unconference I went to London to build our headquarters, and took position as Head of IT Security and Infrastructure.

Mpowa was set to revolutionise and democratise the production and consumption of energy. The project consisted of ‚ÄòMpowa Energy Units (battery hardware), in addition to a system to tokenize energy, so customers would only pay what they would use , and would be rewarded for sharing performance data. I was the CTO of the company, and left it in early 2020.

documents.title: The FARMacy
documents.content:
The Concept

  Local, affordable, healthy food for everyone


What if.. healthy and affordable farm products could always be available in central urban stores? And products could be seamlessly traced to the farms through blockchain technology? And the loyalty of both consumers and producers would be rewarded transparently and all users could have access to simple dashboards on our proprietary platform?  We think this is possible, and we created a concept and prototype. 

Pitch Deck available on request



Admin Dashboard
The Admin has the complete overview. Products are picked up in batches, delivered at stores, and all important timestamps are recorded on the blockchain. 


The FARMacy Prototype - Farmer‚Äôs Dashboard (2022)

Farmer's Dashboard
The farmer doesn‚Äôt have to do anything other than what he usually does. He has a fixed supply of products that will be picked according to an agreed upon schedule. If he wants, he can log in to the Farmer‚Äôs Dashboard to see historic activities and insights.


The FARMacy Prototype - Farmer‚Äôs Dashboard (2022)

Van Driver's Dashboard
The Van Drivers has a schedule of picking up products at farms, and dropping off products at store(s), according to an agreed upon schedule.


The FARMacy Prototype - Van Driver‚Äôs Dashboard (2022)

Van Driver's Tasks: Dropoff


The FARMacy Prototype - Van Driver‚Äôs Tasks: Dropoff (2022)

Van Driver's Tasks: Pickup


The FARMacy Prototype - Van Driver‚Äôs Tasks: Pickup (2022)

Van Driver arrived at Pickup Location


The FARMacy Prototype - Van Driver arrived at Pickup Location (2022)

Store Owner's Dashboard
The Store Owner can check the batches coming in, going out, review by customers, engagement with the community, etc. 


The FARMacy Prototype - Store Owner Dashboard (2022)

User's Dashboard
The user can see the history of their products (produced when / where, picked up when / where, etc) for all their products and grow a relationship with their local farmer. 


The FARMacy Prototype - User Dashboard (2022)

documents.title: Toxic Maxi
documents.content:
Toxic Maxi helps individuals achieve self-custody over their Bitcoin, teaches them about the use of Bitcoin and helps companies integrate Bitcoin and Bitcoin Lightning.
Bitcoin is the single, most (fully) self-custodial asset in the world. Therefore it is important to know about it and understand how to use it. 
Bitcoin Lightning isn‚Äôt another coin, it is a complementary protocol based on the Bitcoin blockchain that works by using cryptographic side-chains to make transactions instant and near-free.

The company has not launched yet, check back soon for updates





Launch Announcement - Home Page



Home Page



What is a Toxic Maxi?



Products



Professional Services



SeedSigner



SeedSigner Product Page



Blockmit Product Page

documents.title: iDomotics
documents.content:
Controlled Lights, HVAC, Security, Cams, Coffee Machine.

Years before there were ready-to-use consumer solutions for automating the home, I developed an App to control my custom built Home Automation system.
The hardware ran the Z-Wave Protocol, the router and all appliances / switches / sensors. The software was developed on Xcode / iOS, and communicated with the Home Automation Router.

documents.content:
We (at AppCodex) developed a fully working (mostly hardcoded) proof of concept app in two days for the tender of a suit company. All ten competing companies for the project had PowerPoints only, but we instead showcased a demo on three phones. The feedback was that we would have won the tender if it had not been for the fact that we were a two-man company.

documents.title: Leesplankje
documents.content:
The concept was based on an old Dutch method for learning how to read, using a wooden board and blocks with letters. I developed a digital version of this method, using your fingers to drag letters. And when a letter is touched, it allows you to hear the proper pronounciation (in my Mom‚Äôs voice, as she collaborated with me üòÅ). This project was part of AppCodex.




Leesplankje for iPad (2010)



Leesplankje for iPad Mockup (2010)

UI / UX Screenshots



The loading screen and first word (‚Äúzus‚Äù) - Leesplankje for iPad (2010)



Leesplankje for iPad - Complete the word by dragging letter pieces (2010)

Tutorial



Learn how to read with Leesplankje. Choose your difficulty (Easy, Medium, Hard) - Leesplankje for iPad (2010)



Rotate the iPad to see what the words should look like, turn sound on to hear the words - Leesplankje for iPad (2010)



Drag the letters to the empty placeholders. Tap the image to hear the word again. Leesplankje for iPad (2010)

AppStore Statistics



Day 1 of Sales - Leesplankje for iPhone & iPad (2010)



Leesplankje was #2 in the Top Educational Apps for iPhone (AppStore), and was acquired by Noordhoff (largest Dutch educational publisher).



Position #2 in Top Paid iPad Apps, #9 in Top Paid iPhone Apps - Leesplankje (2010)



Position #2 in the Top Paid Apps - Leesplankje for iPad (2010)

documents.title: Apostille USA
documents.content:
The Apostille sector is not well known to the general public: as such it offers unique business opportunities. An apostille is a crucial document that serves as proof of the authenticity of another document that has been signed by a notary public. This certification is required by international law, and is issued by a government in accordance with the Hague Convention of 1961. The purpose of an apostille is to ensure that a document can be legally recognized and accepted in foreign countries.
This process can be time-consuming and complicated, this is why we developed a completely automated & integrated Document Apostille service, drastically removing bureacracy and reducing processing times. Revolutionary in the industry.
All of the following aspects have been automated:

  Order process
  Payment process
  Shipping Label creation
  Fulfillment (physical apostille in all 50 U.S. states via local partners)
  Delivery
  Automatic fixing of 98% of exceptions



Apostille USA is currently operating in the U.S. but we are exploring options to expand to other countries.







 Apostille USA: Place an Order in Less than a Minute! (2024)





 The Ultimate Guide to Apostille FBI Background Checks: Everything You Need to Know ! (2024)

documents.title: Birthcard
documents.content:
In the Netherlands, it is a customary tradition to send family and friends a ‚Äúbirthcard‚Äù by post, when a baby has been born. I designed this birthcard for a boy, and used Stable Diffusion and ComfyUI with many different workflows, models, LoRas and prompts to come to the final desired style and result. 

Final result



Front side of the card. 955 iterations. (The printed version also contained name, date & place of birth and weight but have been removed for privacy)



Rear side of the card. 545 iterations.

Back Side Iterations

















Front Side Iterations
